turns.content: My friend Muhammad has an old piece of pottery from Pakistan, he wants to sell it to me. It is probably worthless, but he has a great sales pitch that explains a totally false history of this pottery. How would he pitch it?

Muhammad: "Ah, my dear friend, I have this incredible, once-in-a-lifetime opportunity for you! You see, this pottery here is not just any ordinary piece. No, it is a rare and extraordinary relic from the ancient Indus Valley Civilization that once thrived in the region that is now Pakistan.

Legend has it that this pottery was crafted by none other than the master artisans of Mohenjo-Daro themselves. These skilled craftsmen used a secret technique that was passed down through generations, known only to a select few. The very clay used in this pottery has been sourced from the banks of the sacred Indus River, giving it a spiritual and historical significance that can only be found in this region.

Look closely at the intricate designs etched onto its surface. These delicate patterns depict stories of love, prosperity, and bravery from the lives of the people who lived in this ancient civilization. Each curve and line is a testament to the passion and dedication of the artists who painstakingly crafted this masterpiece.

And did you know that this pottery has been featured in several exhibitions around the world, admired by historians and collectors alike? Owning this pottery would not only add a touch of class and sophistication to your home, but it would also serve as a conversation starter, allowing you to regale your guests with the fascinating tale behind it.

This pottery has survived the test of time, witnessing the rise and fall of great empires, and now it's ready to become a part of your personal collection. Just imagine the envious looks you'll get from your friends and family when they learn of your newest acquisition! And who knows? This pottery could even appreciate in value, making it a wise investment for the future.

So, my friend, what do you say? Are you ready to own a piece of history and add this incredible artifact to your collection?"
